attributes.action: Create more bicycle lanes in Saint Albans City
attributes.additional_details: All of the people creating this petition are 13-year-olds that cycle to school on a daily basis. Creating more bike lanes would make it a safer experience for all of us, along with our friends, and would encourage people to use their bikes more and reduce car and motorcycle usage.
attributes.background: We would like more bicycle lanes in Saint Albans City, Hertfordshire so that people riding their bikes to school or work have a safer experience, in turn encouraging people to ride bikes more and reduce car and motorcycle usage. All of us creating this petition are 13-year-olds that cycle to school.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local cycle lanes are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition Hertfordshire County Council directly. Find out how to do this here: https://democracy.hertfordshire.gov.uk/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1
